items.title: Developer Evangelist
items.bio: Brent is a Developer Evangelist for Twilio representing the Philadelphia metro. He is a software developer who has been working with Microsoft technologies since 2004. His interests include client and mobile application development and user experience design with a recent emphasis on cross-platform mobile applications and client-side JavaScript frameworks. Other platforms he has worked with include WPF, Silverlight, Windows Forms, Windows Phone, and Windows 8. Brent is the author of Designing for Windows 8, a Windows 8 design primer from Apress. He is a Microsoft MVP in Client App Development as well as a Xamarin MVP.
items.short_bio: Developer Evangelist @Twilio. Developer. Designer. Speaker. Author. Microsoft MVP. Xamarin MVP. Author of Designing for Windows 8 (http://bit.ly/designwin8 )
items.name: Brent Schooley

items.title: Sr Software Engineer
items.bio: David Bates has been hacking hardware and software for over 20 years, starting with a pioneering project for Dow Corning and IBM involving software controlled robotic arms. He has since become proficient in a dozen languages and APIs; has programmed on just about every type of device phone, desktop, and embedded devices. He is well-known in the community for using Arduinos and other embedded systems to hack everyday objects, transforming them into something fun.
items.short_bio: Programmer, Graphic Designer, Webmaster, Handyman, Logical Thinker, Husband, Father, and an INTP.
items.name: David Bates

items.title: CEO
items.bio: The CEO of Grok Interactive, Jason is a long-time programmer, mentor, and teacher who has worked with all manner of proven talent in web and mobile application development. He is a published technical author, co-founder of Codeup, and organizer of the San Antonio Web Developer Meetup.
items.short_bio: Web Developer, Rubyist, Entrepreneur, and Disneyphile

* $250 reimbursement towards plane from Texas
* 2 nights hotel stay 5/12-5/14

items.title: Entrepreneur in Residence
items.bio: Mike Hostetler is an Entrepreneur & Technologist currently working to help technical teams grow and thrive. Mike formerly founded appendTo, a boutique consultancy born out of the jQuery project. He is an active OSS supporter and currently serves as editor-in-chief of ModernWeb.com.  Mike is passionate about Remote Work, the Future of Work, Leadership and helping others succeed.
items.short_bio: Entrepreneur & Technologist. CIO @RentLikeAChamp, Entrepreneur in Residence @tablexi, Passionate about #RemoteWork, #OSS, Sold @appendTo, 2015

items.title: Senior Developer
items.bio: Devin works at Big Room Studios as a senior developer and open-source miscreant.  He's a collaborator with Waterline ORM and Refluxjs, the author of several incredibly strange Polymerjs behaviors, and a core contributor to the hapi web server framework.  When he's not tippy-tapping on his keyboard, Devin is likely smashing his drum set around or delicately ice skating on the fine ponds of Portland, Maine.

items.title: CEO
items.bio: I manage Langa (www.langa.io), an open-source software company that helps businesses deliver incredible web experiences. We apply the same pedigree of process to our software solutions that we've employed to build Trails (github.com/trailsjs/trails), a modern MVC framework for node.js.
items.short_bio: software developer and consultant. CEO of http://www.balderdash.io . student of business, music, chess, and life.

items.short_bio: Works at @wedgies. Hacker. Maker, Heart breaker. Maybe the other way around. Slightly awkward turtle.

items.title: Sr. Cloud Architect
items.bio: David Makogon has been a software creationist and architect for about 30 years. He’s currently a Senior Azure Architect at Microsoft, and has the dubious title of World’s First Former Azure MVP and MongoDB Master. David spends a ton of energy working in the cloud, as well as NoSQL databases and polyglot persistence. Outside of computing, he is an avid photographer and family man, with a penchant for puns and an uncanny ability to read backwards.
items.short_bio: Software architect alpha-geek in mid-Atlantic. Microsoft Windows Azure Architect Evangelist, former Windows Azure MVP, part-time photog, full-time family guy.
items.name: David Makogon

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.bio: Erik is a senior engineer at Microsoft, and based in the New York City area. He’s a React and open source enthusiast, and is one of the earlier contributors to the react native UWP platform that was recently announced at F8. Erik also works on a team that's building a mobile navigation platform for the visually impaired using OpenStreetMap and 3D spatial audio.
items.short_bio: Open source software engineer at Microsoft.

items.title: CEO
items.bio:
Erik Olson is a programmer, business consultant, and the President of 80|20 (http://8020.co), a software applications and consulting company in Norfolk, VA. Erik has over 15 years of professional experience in software development and managing software projects ranging from multi-year, multi-million dollar DoD enterprise initiatives, to line-of-business applications for small and mid-sized businesses.

Erik holds a Bachelor's and MBA, both from Virginia Tech, is a Professional Project Manager (PMP), serves as the Past President of PMI Hampton Roads, is a mentor and investor at Hatch Norfolk, and is a software columnist for Inside Business.
items.short_bio: I run 80|20 (@8020co), a software applications and consulting agency in Norfolk, VA.
items.name: Erik Olson

Brian created the RevolutionConf website.

Jeff also co-organizes the 757 WordPress Developers meetup group. In his off time, he's usually messing around with classic arcade machines or other various hardware. You can find Jeff on Twitter at @TheJeffMatson.

items.title: Software Engineer
items.short_bio: Software engineer and GDG Hampton Roads organizer
items.bio:
Application Developer, Database Administrator, and Project Manager in a wide variety of business applications. Interested in client/server and relational database design using Oracle, MySQL, and MS-SQL Server. Always interested in migration projects, as well as close interaction with the DB manufacturers. Particularly interested in mobile phone software development.

Specialties: C#/.Net, Java, Javascript, C/C++, Visual Basic, PHP, ASP, Cold Fusion, Perl, Python, HTML, CSS/XSL, XML, Node.js, WDDX, WML/WAP, DHTML. UML, Boyce-Codd ERD, Use-Cases, MVC, N-Tier, Mach-II., Ephesoft
items.name: Ken Taylor

items.title: Software Engineer
items.short_bio: Ruby, JavaScript, Sass, iOS. Stinky Cheese & Beer Advocate. Working at @CustomInk and loving it!
items.bio:
Influences & Values:
* A hardcore aversion to complexity.
* Often solve low level problems in isolation to keep focus on high level needs.
* Will not use libraries that are untested.
* Reading code. The docs are in there too. Bundle open is your friend.
* Teaching is the best avenue to learning. Perform occupational maintenance.

As an long time blogger and open source software advocate, I highly suggest learning about my skills from other related sources. The software I write, information I publish, and technology I advocate paint a better picture of what I do and love about my craft.

Software developer that loves problem solving using Ruby, JavaScript (CoffeeScript) or Objective-C. Previous careers in ops, marketing and design combine to add value at all levels. I take ownership of my tasks, have a strong work ethic, and require no hand holding. So whether it is a low level database stack or a high level user interface design, I am right at home.

Specialties: Ruby, Rails, JavaScript/CoffeeScript, Objective-C, ActiveRecord, HTML5/CSS3, SASS/Compass, Testing With MiniTest::Spec, Mocha.js, PhantomJS, Git, SQL Server.
items.name: Ken Collins

He has been consulting and working in web, print, and film/video/3d for 20 years.

items.title: General Manager
items.short_bio: Versatility is my superpower. The list of things I can't do is small, the list of things I won’t try has exactly 0 items. Working hard, creating good things.
items.bio: An early adopter of just about everything, Matt Paddock is a student of emerging technology trends and an advocate for collaboration through social networking. His professional experience over the past 20 years spans all facets of business operations, strategy, and human resources, plus experience in social media, marketing, and public relations. An accomplished career-switcher, Matt's first chapter included over a decade of studying and working as a professional musician, which gives him a unique perspective on both business and the arts.

items.bio: A full stack Software Developer and aspiring Maker, George Stocker has been building software for over 10 years. Working with some of the largest brands on the internet, he's developed sustainable software on a multitude of platforms for clients ranging from AOL to the US Government. His passion is creating solutions that users love using methodologies that ensure that software is scalable and sustainable. As a father to two young girls, he feels a special connection with the mission of making STEM accessible and fun to girls. George was formerly a Senior Software Developer at Higher Logic, which creates collaboration software for non-profit organizations, and a Software Developer for The Motley Fool, a company dedicated to helping people invest better.
items.notes:
* Budget rental car from 5/12 to 5/14
* Mileage reimbursement from Washington, DC to Virginia Beach, VA

items.title: Director of Apprenticeship & Training
items.bio:
"
Erika Carlson was studying psychology in 2011 when she wrote her first line of Python code. She fell in love with programming, decided to change paths, and became a software developer. Since then she has built Java enterprise software, created websites for non-profits, and worked on iOS applications with millions of users. She is currently the Director of Apprenticeship at Detroit Labs. Erika founded the Detroit chapter of Girl Develop It, and teaches programming and web development to students of all ages. She is passionate about the potential of technology to make a difference in people's lives and create positive change in the world."
items.short_bio: Director of Apprenticeship & Training @DetroitLabs. iOS developer. Happiness enthusiast. Detroit native. Other projects: @GDIdet & @hackerfellows.
items.name: Erika Carlson

items.title: Technical Evangelist
items.bio: Heather Shapiro is a Technical Evangelist in Microsoft's Developer Experience group, where she educates developers on Microsoft's new technologies. In this role, Heather works closely with students and developer communities across the North East to understand the newest technologies and architectures. Prior to becoming a Technical Evangelist, Heather completed her undergraduate degree at Duke University and graduated in the Class of 2015. She received Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and Statistical Science, and completed an Honors Thesis about employing Bayesian Approaches to Understanding Music Popularity. Heather blogs at http://microheather.com and tweets at http://twitter.com/microheather.
items.short_bio: 'And though she be but little, she is fierce.' -- Duke Blue Devil wandering through NYC as a Technical Evangelist for @Microsoft!
items.name: Heather Shapiro
